Articles.Content: Hi all. So, just testing a lander at Laythe in 1.1 using Hyperedit, only to find when I get there I have no orbit lines? Anyone else have this? Not the first time this has happened but thought the first time it could just be "one of those things" but now I see it is not?

Do not hyperedit things, fly them instead. Space karma got you.

Apparently HE do not change the state of the craft to 'flying' or 'orbiting' when you transfer it from the launch pad. Discovered this by accident.

If you hover the mouse over your craft in the map view you'll see it's 'landed'.

A quick fix - try setting orbit parameters in HE manually (until it changes to orbiting) or simply change the state in the save file.

Edited April 28, 2016 by cicatrix

that does make sence and yes it does say landed. thankyou and i will look at this again.
now after a restart it works. I think its just tempremental tbh, but at least I can practise my Laythe landings/launch now

Sorry for multiple posts but heres the answer.......suppose I want to goto Laythe......dont hyperedit there first, simply choose any other body THEN change it to your required destination (Laythe in my example)........boom! instant orbit lines and info

I have found in 1.1 with hyperedit that some configurations of parts can cause a problem (still not sure exactly which though).  I bet that as well as no orbit lines you also couldn't timewarp (and would get a message about can't time warp while moving over terrain).  I've seen that a few times while testing 1.1. Also when decoupling part of the craft you get orbit lines and timewarp back but when you warp the decoupled part either vanishes or remains attached to the same point in space.
Yep, timewarp can be a problem too, requiring multiple reloads to make it (sometimes) work.
I've found that sometimes this same bug occurs simply from taking off after landing on something, so it doesn't seem to be a HyperEdit bug.
